lines.text: Enter Constable, ORLEANS, BOURBON, DAUPHIN, and RAMBURES

lines.speaker: orleans
lines.text: O seigneur! le jour est perdu, tout est perdu!

lines.speaker: dauphin
lines.text: Mort de ma vie! all is confounded, all! Reproach and everlasting shame Sits mocking in our plumes. O merchante fortune! Do not run away.

lines.speaker: constable
lines.text: Why, all our ranks are broke.

lines.speaker: dauphin
lines.text: O perdurable shame! let's stab ourselves. Be these the wretches that we play'd at dice for?

lines.speaker: orleans
lines.text: Is this the king we sent to for his ransom?

lines.speaker: bourbon
lines.text: Shame and eternal shame, nothing but shame! Let us die in honour: once more back again; And he that will not follow Bourbon now, Let him go hence, and with his cap in hand, Like a base pander, hold the chamber-door Whilst by a slave, no gentler than my dog, His fairest daughter is contaminated.

lines.speaker: constable
lines.text: Disorder, that hath spoil'd us, friend us now! Let us on heaps go offer up our lives.

lines.speaker: orleans
lines.text: We are enow yet living in the field To smother up the English in our throngs, If any order might be thought upon.

lines.speaker: bourbon
lines.text: The devil take order now! I'll to the throng: Let life be short; else shame will be too long.
